CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 14, 1951, pg. 16, reads: "The Life of a Champion - Training for a heavyweight championship fight is serious business, yet there are times when Ezzard Charles gets a chance to relax and concentrate on other things not directly connected with the fight game. in above photos the champ is doing just that at his training quarters in Ligonier, Pa., where he is nearing top form for his Wednesday night meeting with Jersey Joe Walcott.  Upper left photo shows Jimmy Johnson, the champ's cousin, and Lloyd Gibson, one of his sparring partners from Cincinnati, playing cards.  On the left, Ez sharpens his eye on the pool table, while in the middle pic he takes part in one of his favorite hobbies, playing records.  Lower left, Charles eats his evening meal, surrounded by members of his stable.  Lower right photo is a view of the palatial home of Earl Stroupe, where the champ is residing while in Ligonier.  The above pictures were taken inside the home."
TitMainTitle: Boxer Ezzard Charles shooting pool with sparring partner Lloyd Gibson at training camp in Ligonier, Pennsylvania before the Joe Walcott vs. Ezzard Charles fight
